comment.text: The "Rooms removed" translation key is used to display a success message when rooms are successfully deleted from a selected folder. This message appears in dialogs after deletion and is translated to fit various languages. It indicates that room removal has been completed successfully.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Le stanze sono state rimosse' is a literal translation and sounds somewhat awkward in Italian. A more natural phrasing would be 'Stanze rimosse' or 'Le stanze eliminate'.

The translation 'ルームが削除されました' (Room ga sakujo saremashita) literally translates to "Rooms were deleted." While technically correct, it conveys a more formal and passive tone than the original "Rooms removed." A more appropriate and active translation might be "削除されたルーム" (Sakujo sareta ruum) which translates to "Removed rooms".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 削除されたルーム (Sakujo sareta ruum)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'කාමර ඉවත් කෙරිණි' while literally translatable to "rooms were removed", sounds slightly awkward and overly formal in Sinhala. A more natural phrasing would be preferred.
The Serbian (Cyrillic) translation "Собе уклоњене" is not a correct translation of "Rooms removed". It is grammatically incorrect and doesn't convey the intended meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: The correct translation should be something like "Уклоњени простори" (Uklonjeni prostori) or "Избрисане собе" (Izbrisane sobe).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Đã xóa phòng" is understandable, a more natural and precise translation of "Rooms removed" would be "Các phòng đã bị xóa" or "Phòng đã bị xóa". "Đã xóa phòng" is grammatically correct but lacks the passive voice inherent in the English phrase, implying someone performed the removal.
